channel.title: David Seah on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in David Seah on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: on tracking the minimum aliquot of attention
item.description:
on time tracking, in general, an observation from last year:
It's hard to have great weird ideas when you're tracking every minute to determine who it gets billed to. The cognitive overhead of deciding which part of your brain gets dinged for each good thought gets in the way of flow. My days have a lot more specific time points where something needs to happen at a certain time, no compromises.
